column3:
🚨 We’re hiring a Senior Web3/React.js Developer to help us scale token sale app — a real-world token presale and staking platform that connects crypto with actual services like food preorders and loyalty rewards.

You’ll be joining a lean, focused team building the next phase of our dApp — including staking mechanics, on-chain rewards, and seamless user dashboards.

Role Details:
- Position: Senior Software Developer (Solidity / Frontend / Full Stack)
- Tech Stack: ethers.js, Solidity, React, TypeScript, Node.js, Vite
- Work Type: Fully Remote, async-friendly

What We’re Looking For:
- Experienced blockchain devs with Solidity and smart contract expertise
- Engineers comfortable working across the stack — React.js/TypeScript + backend APIs
- Frontend developers with deep React.js/Next.js experience and Web3 integration exposure
- Clean, well-structured code habits and Git proficiency
- A team-first, async-friendly, product-focused mindset
- Experience working with existing codebases and iterating fast

NDA is required prior to codebase access and technical call.
column7: Senior Web3/React.js Developer – Token Presale dApp
column10: 5 weeks PTO, company’s bonus plan
column15: Multiple stages - NDA, technical interview, final interview

column3:
Engineering at Swiftly
Engineering at Swiftly is not only about writing code – we believe in creating empowered product teams that work together to conceptualize new features and bring them to life. Each team aims to strike a balance between delivering incremental improvements, creating prototypes to test new ideas and mitigate risks, and building scalable software using industry best practices. We’re guided by a mission to positively impact transit riders, and we embrace humility and intentionality in how we make technical decisions so that we best meet our customers’ needs.
column10:
Benefits:
• Competitive salary
• Equity compensation (company ownership) for every employee
• Medical, Dental and Vision
• Retirement with Employer Match
• Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
• Home office setup reimbursement
• Monthly cell/internet reimbursement
• Monthly "Be Well" stipend
• Flexible PTO with a recommended minimum
• Flexible work environment
• 16 paid holidays - including months without US national holidays
• 8 fully paid weeks of leave for child birth/adoption

column3: Swiftly is on a mission to help cities move more efficiently. We are the leading transit data platform for agencies to share real-time passenger information, manage day-to-day operations, and improve service performance. Today, over 180 transit agencies in 11 countries – including LA Metro, MARTA, SEPTA, and MBTA – rely on Swiftly to improve on-time performance by up to 40% and increase passenger information accuracy by up to 50%. The result is better service reliability, increased ridership, and more efficient transit operations.

column3:
The world is building a new financial system — we believe that for it to succeed, it needs fast and accurate data that people can trust. Our infrastructure already powers giants like Coinbase, MoonPay, Uniswap, TradingView and hundreds more. We’re in a growth period where every month has been more exciting than the last.

The Codex culture is that of trust, fun, and constant improvement. Ideas move from concept to production in a matter of days, not months. We are a small team that knows the best work is done when deep work is possible, inefficient meetings are removed, and creativity is fostered.
‍
We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our team and play a key role in building the next generation of our user-facing web app (defined.fi) that was created to help dogfood our API product (codex.io). You'll design and deliver elegant and impactful solutions on a cutting-edge front-end stack, with the agency to dive deeper into the Codex API stack as you see fit. You’ll help shape products used by millions of people worldwide.

* Overly competitive foosball

column3:
We operate OpenStack as our IaaS cloud platform, with multiple deployments including the Arbutus Cloud - Canada's largest research cloud service, operated in partnership with the Digital Research Alliance of Canada. We also operate a number of Kubernetes clusters both within OpenStack and on bare metal, including large deployments serving national and international research projects in physics and astronomy.

I joined the team last April, and have been incredibly impressed with the team and work being done. We are operating a non trivial cloud platform (~35,000 cores, 300TB memory, 40TB storage) that is relied upon by significant research groups such as CADC and CERN.
column6: University of Victoria - Research Computing Services
column7: Senior Advanced Research Computing Systems Administrator
column10: Additional $5,700 Market Adjustment + 22 days Vacation (after first year). The position is listed as a two-year term and has every intention to transition into Permanent Full Time.

The Codex culture is that of trust, fun, and constant improvement. Ideas move from concept to production in a matter of days, not months. We are a small team that knows the best work is done when deep work is possible, inefficient meetings are removed, and creativity is fostered.

We're looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team to influence and implement engineering efforts across various domains such as indexing, federated GraphQL, and observability. You'll have the agency to deploy solutions meaningfully impacting millions of people worldwide depending on our services.  

We have a spacious office in Market Square with flexible hybrid and remote work options available, though you must be Canadian.

column3:
Codename Entertainment is an award-winning, people-first game studio in Victoria, BC.  We're a work environment focused on making fun games and making work fun!  We have a great opportunity for someone looking to step into the next stage of their career and be the Technical Lead on our flagship game, Idle Champions.  This role is a great opportunity to stretch your technical skills, contribute your voice to game development, and lead a team.
While the position will remain open until filled, we'll begin reviewing applications on Monday, September 8, 2025.
Not certain if you'd be a good fit for the role or not?  We'd still encourage you to apply.  We recognize that the best candidates come from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
column10:
Comprehensive employer-paid health, dental, and life insurance benefits
Paid-time Off: 3 weeks vacation (increasing to 4 weeks after 1 year), 6 sick days, and 4 personal days, with the ability to carry forward unused time off
Additional Perks: Annual funding for PD & games; mentorship program with industry professionals; people-first work environment!

column3:
Based in Denver, Colorado, Inspirato (NASDAQ: ISPO) is a luxury travel company providing affluent travelers access to a managed and controlled portfolio of hand-selected vacation options to ensure world-class service and certainty. Our portfolio features 100+ destinations, 350+ luxury homes, 50+ hotels and resorts, and custom travel experiences worldwide, available exclusively to our members. 
 
At Inspirato, our mission is to inspire lasting memories and relationships by enhancing the way our members experience the world. Guided by our core values of care, courage, collaboration, and curiosity, we strive to deliver exceptional service and unique travel opportunities that create unforgettable experiences. Join us in our journey to enrich lives through meaningful connections and inspire a world of lasting memories!
column10:
Bonus: Eligible for the company’s bonus plan, with a target of up to 10% of your annual salary.
 
Paid Time Off: Accrues each pay period, totaling 15 days annually, plus nine paid holidays.
 
FAM Trip: After one year of employment, eligible for one three-to-four-night stay per calendar year in an Inspirato property, subject to availability and program terms.

column3:
The Team
Join the Cyber Security and Digital Trust team as one of four Directors leading the BC Government’s Cyber Security Leadership group—an experienced and collaborative team committed to protecting public systems and services. You’ll manage a team of 30 and work closely with Ministry Security Officers, fellow Directors, and OCIO leadership to ensure strong cyber controls and rapid threat response. This team values equity, diversity, and inclusion, and offers a supportive environment where your leadership helps safeguard the province’s digital infrastructure alongside knowledgeable experts.

The Role
If you’re passionate about cybersecurity and want to make a meaningful impact, this role offers an exciting opportunity to protect government systems and safeguard information entrusted by the public. You’ll be at the forefront of defending against evolving cyber threats, managing innovative solutions that ensure stable, secure access to services for both citizens and government clients. With a strong support network, respected responsibilities, and the chance to continuously learn in a fast-moving environment, this position welcomes diverse perspectives and values the expertise you bring to strengthening digital resilience.

column3:
We provide people with an end-to end solution for getting new buildings bought and built with a few clicks online. 

You get to focus on the User Experience and Visual Attractiveness of the site and pages because we have a developer working on the backend machinations with you. 

We’re lean, decisive, and focused on getting a working MVP into the world — not dragging things out. You’ll have clear goals, fast feedback, and room to bring your own best practices to the table.

If you're someone who values clarity, good architecture (in code and buildings), and minimalist design — you'll probably enjoy this.

Open until filled — looking to start right away.

We're profitable, have grown the team from 2 to 70 people in 5 years, and have a three-year revenue growth of over 400%, ranking us 98th on The Globe and Mail’s Canada’s Top Growing Companies of 2024 list. We are also excited to announce that Makeship has officially been Great Place to Work-Certified™ for 2 years

column3:
At Tenor, we’re on a mission to transform leadership development - making every manager more effective, at the world's largest companies, through the power of AI. We're based in San Francisco, have a global team, and would love to hire in Victoria (one of the co-founders lived in Victoria for a while!)

Management is the most important activity at a company for organizational performance, employee experience, and retention. And when managers get better, the business does too.

That’s why we built Tenor, the AI for leadership development. Our platform lets managers practice hard conversations - like feedback, performance reviews, terminations, or compensation changes - with realistic voice AI characters. Then we give them instant feedback to help them improve.

We’re backed by great investors and our enterprise customers include major name-brand companies.

We're looking for a:

👩‍💻 Full-stack web developer with 5+ years of experience (mid-to-senior level).

⚡️ Should have at least 1–2 years of serious TypeScript/JavaScript experience, and be comfortable working in our NextJS stack.

🙌 Must be a great culture fit – kind, thoughtful, collaborative, and generally someone you’d be thrilled to work with.
column10:
We pay our employees fairly, with strong compensation packages

We offer great healthcare benefits, a learning and development stipend, a home office stipend, generous paid time off, and commuter benefits

You get to work with great people on a high-performing team, that genuinely cares about each other.

column3:
This is different from your typical tech job. You'll play a key part in developing and enhancing Ocean AID’s software and hardware from its MVP stage to a universally adopted, industry-defining, application that is responsive to rapidly evolving customer needs. Your work will directly impact Ocean AID’s products. 

Our mission at Ocean AID is to provide fast and accurate detections of underwater objects to help create cleaner, healthier, and safer ocean ecosystems. We have a research and development project and are looking to hire a full-time experienced Software Engineer.
column10:
Why join our great team?

Competitive hourly rate, Flexible remote work arrangement, Professional development opportunities, Potential for salary adjustments based on performance, Shares - employee option pools, and much more!

column3: Part of the Redbrick portfolio of companies, Paved is a newsletter advertising platform connecting publishers and advertisers. Brands, meanwhile, gain a direct line to targeted audiences through dedicated emails, sponsored placements, and blog integrations alongside trusted publishers. Redbrick is proud to be B Corp Certified and has been named one of Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers for five years running

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including Madden NFL football, EA Sports FC soccer, NHL® hockey, and EA SPORTS UFC.

column10: It's an individual contributor role, so it's unionized with all that entails in terms of protection and benefits. As a result there's a generally decent vacation policy enforced by collective bargaining agreement with the standard stats plus a minimum of 5 additional "recharge" days, then an unlimited PTO plan with a minimum of two weeks, but you'll certainly be able to take more than the minimum. It's annoyingly complicated to describe, but I'm happy to explain in detail mynown experiences. On-call is also compensated in addition to salary.

column10: The job includes union membership with a robust pension plan and extended health and dental benefits. There are annual union-negotiated and performance-based salary increases (typically ~3-4% per year), up to the current ceiling for this position of $120,822 (the ceiling also increases regularly). There is a 35 hour weekly work standard to support a healthy work/life balance. Up to 29 vacation days per year are granted, with university closures (including Dec 25 through Jan 1 inclusive) as additional days off. The employer also pays 7.65% above and beyond your salary into your pension, and pays for a cell phone and mobile data. There is funding for professional development and travel/conferences.

column3:
🚀 We're Hiring: Junior IT System Administrator at Certn!🚀

Certn, based in Victoria, BC, Canada, is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior IT System Administrator to join our dynamic team. This role is crucial in supporting our IT infrastructure and ensuring seamless day-to-day operations.

As a Junior IT System Administrator at Certn, you will:
* Maintain and troubleshoot IT infrastructure, including workstations.
* Assist in the onboarding and offboarding processes, setting up and revoking access as needed.
* Provide helpdesk support to end-users, resolving issues swiftly to maintain high productivity.
* Document system configurations and contribute to IT training and resources.
* Collaborate on projects to optimize and enhance our IT environment.

Why Join Us?
* Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and efficiency.
* Work in a supportive environment that encourages professional growth and development.
* Enjoy a competitive package of benefits, including:
 * Comprehensive health & dental benefits
 * 4 weeks of paid vacation
 * 12 wellness days

If you're passionate about IT and eager to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you. Check out our job posting on LinkedIn or visit our careers page at https://lnkd.in/d8HZY8js to apply.

#Hiring #JuniorITSystemAdministrator #TechJobs #ITJobs #NowHiring #JoinOurTeam #LivingTheDream #CertnCareers

column3:
Join the Canadian Astronomy Data Centre (CADC) development team at the National Research Council Canada and help build the Canadian SKA Regional Centre (SRC) of the Square Kilometer Array Observatory (SKAO).  Become part of a diverse team of twenty computer scientists and astronomers, developing advanced solutions to support world class science and deliver services for processing data from the world's largest radio telescope.

We are looking for enthusiastic and creative developers to help build the next-generation astronomy radio data and processing centre in the following areas:
      A) User Interface and User Experience (UI/UX) design and development
      B) Back-end web service design and development
      C) Cloud engineering design and development

Application process described in the job posting.  Job posting closes February 22nd, 2024

column10:
The job includes union membership with a robust pension plan and extended health and dental benefits. There are annual union-negotiated and performance-based salary increases (typically ~4% per year), up to the current ceiling for this position of $115,304 (the ceiling also increases regularly). There is a 35 hour weekly work standard to support a healthy work/life balance. Up to 29 vacation days per year are provided, with university closures (including Dec 25 through to Jan 1) as additional free holidays. The employer also pays 7.65% above and beyond your salary into your pension, pays for your cell phone and mobile data, and there is an annual market adjustment bonus of $5,700. 
There is funding for professional development and travel/conferences, and funding to assist with relocation to Victoria, BC (one of the most beautiful and desirable cities in Canada).

column3:
Closing date: November 17, 2022

- 20 senior positions to fill with various language requirements, including both unilingual and bilingual positions.
-We are looking for candidates with skill sets across various disciplines such as solutions architecture, IT/cyber security, cloud, product management, enterprise architecture, digital identity, machine learning/AI/advanced analytics, and critical application development.
- pilot program will last for two (2) years, starting from the day successful candidates are hired
- applicants welcome from anywhere in Canada 
-  hiring process might be slow, esp if you need to do security clearance, but worthwhile if looking for a federal job in your field after the private sector. 
••••••
Join #GCDigital – come work for the Government of Canada to contribute to key digital priorities and improve the lives of people in Canada.

Are you a technical expert in the public or private sector?

Are you passionate about transforming government to better serve citizens and residents?

Do you want to work across federal departments to implement more agile, open and user-focused solutions to improve the lives of Canadians?

The Government of Canada IT Senior Strategist pilot program is designed to seek out top-level technical talent to support our mission to transform services across the federal government.

Become a technical expert with #GCDigital, be part of the solution and work across federal departments to enable delivery of government services for Canadians in a digital age.

You will have the opportunity to provide in-depth technical advice and guidance on significant transformation initiatives or a complex IT discipline on behalf of a department/agency, to ensure the effective digital delivery of services to internal and external clients and stakeholders. You will enhance your work experience by driving innovative, pathfinding technical solutions to realize service/system transformation and advance digital transformation projects in specialized areas of IT, such as:

-Benefit Delivery Modernization at Employment and Social Development Canada
-Digital Platform Modernization at Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
-NextGen HR and Pay at Shared Services Canada

>>> visit the link for details on qualifications
column7: IT Senior Strategist - Recruitment campaign (20 positions open)

column3: Great opportunity for someone to help us establish QA in a rapidly growing team.

Since 2018, Button has been building reliable technology for government with the goal of creating a more sustainable future through digital transformation. Our agile, multi-disciplinary team works on truly impactful technology projects – from emissions reporting for climate action to creating solutions for managing a global pandemic. We create secure, easy-to-use systems that maximize citizen impact.

Defined is looking for experienced developers to join our team. We are remote friendly with the option to go into our downtown Victoria office. We offer 4 weeks vacation, team lunches (or a lunch budget if you’re remote), and other great perks listed in the job posting.

Hi all, I'm Brian and work with the Media Cloud development teams at Workday, and I'm hiring a manager for an existing full-stack software development team. We work primarily on video products that support some some of the world's largest companies. If anything about Workday or this opportunity piques your interest I'd love to chat, you can reach me on the yyjtech slack (Brian Kifiak) or via email at brian.kifiak@workday.com. Thanks!

The Product Experience team is growing, and we have fantastic opportunities for a Lead UX Developer (or, if you prefer, Design Technologist or UI Engineer) on Skyline, our Design Systems team. We have a clear product vision for igniting new ways of inspiring daily goodness in the hands of clients, employees, customers and charitable causes. We need your help on that journey.

Benevity's clients are global brands that are part of your everyday life. They use the software we design and build to run their corporate goodness programs. Their goal is to attract, retain and engage today's diverse global workforce by connecting employees to millions of causes through our ecosystem. 

Benevity sees Design Systems as a crucial part of accelerating our next phase of growth. Building on the strong foundations of our existing component library, we're poised to evolve our system by being even more accessible and keeping our aesthetic modern and fresh. In addition, as we start to expand beyond "atoms" and "molecules" and into "organisms," we are evolving our role to maintainers and supporters of the system so that other teams are empowered and excited to contribute to Benevity's shared design patterns.

You'd be part of a small, but effective creative team adding value to client relations.
Location is in Los Angeles, but we have remote employees all over the US and Victoria, BC.
We are looking for junior through to senior level peeps. Hope you take a look!

Perks and Benefits:
MacBook and related peripherals included for business use.
Flexible remote work environment
Highly creative and interesting projects
Casual
Extended health care

At Weav, we’re building a universal API for integrating with businesses’ commerce platforms (e.g. Stripe, Square, Amazon). 

Weav makes it easy for businesses of all sizes to share commerce data with fintech companies and financial institutions. This enables these businesses to access new services and financial products that help them grow and succeed.

The company is currently fully remote and our team is spread across the USA, Canada and Tel Aviv. We use Golang, Python, Docker, MySQL and AWS. We prefer candidates with 2+ years of industry experience.

We are looking for backend engineers who are interested in building a developer-centric product and are curious/excited about supporting the next generation of fintech. You’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work from development to testing to deployment. 

We’re growing fast, join us!

Apply here: https://www.workatastartup.com/jobs/33566 
Email for questions: zach@weav.co
Website: https://www.weav.co

Please mention "yyj" in your email/application to help us with source tracking!

column3: We’re building products that totally rethink how commercial properties access carbon reduction. The climate crisis demands nothing less. We’ve built an amazing team of thoughtful, empathetic, and creative professionals who love making great things. We’re hiring a technical expert who has brought enterprise-grade machine learning projects to scale. In the first 12 months we will automate commercial energy audits and deploy them across more than 500 buildings. You’ll work alongside our mechanical engineering lead and with an excellent team of developers and researchers. You’ll design a technical roadmap, integrate user specifications, and iteratively deploy automation solutions. Long term, you’ll adapt these methods from region to region as we grow.

We are currently seeking a full-stack developer to join our software development team. We need someone who is capable and passionate about creating reliable, efficient and maintainable software. You will work with our team to ensure that new functionality being introduced to our application is robust and easy to maintain. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important.
A 3-year full-time grant-funded position with the Vancouver Island Drug checking team.

Hundreds of First Nations across Canada are using OneFeather to manage their Membership registrar and conduct major community decisions and voting events transparently. Our web-based technology makes engagement simple and intuitive for First Nations.

Our tech team is small - but growing! We’re looking for a Development Team Lead to build and scale our technical team as we expand our product offerings.

Salary range not included, as the right candidate may be very experienced, or more junior. We'll be up-front about this in our conversation and aim to pay competitively as measured by province wide salary surveys.
We're looking for a Contractor for an upcoming Gov bid. If you're interested, please apply before EOD on Dec 3.

We're looking to hire a FT team member for our Victoria office in addition to sourcing a contractor for an upcoming Gov bid. If you're interested in the contract role, please apply before EOD on Dec 3.

Do you love sports, love video games, and love being a part of online communities? Come and join our team as the Community Liaison & Admin! This role’s primary focus will be on managing our community and support channels – but you’ll also be responsible for general communications, certain internal support/administrative tasks, and becoming an expert player of our games!

Intermediate-ish.

- Victoria downtown office with 11-person Agile dev team, most of whom have been around for years
- Long-term stable government-funded project with big stakeholders coming on board in the next year-ish
- Good management and helpful, results-focused team
- Pretty chill/low-stress
- This is technically the first devops role we've hired for. Yes, we have some legacy stuff to work through, and there will need to be some change (pretty well mapped out already). There are strong existing processes and the folks in charge of the devops tasks now are around to give you a good foundation.
- 5 weeks vacation + solid benefits + 35h weeks
:ocean: :ocean: :ocean: `Code` for the ocean! The *Hakai Institute* is hiring _Software Developers_ :ocean: :ocean: :ocean:

Do you love games? Do you hate when games don’t work properly? Are you looking for an outlet for your perfectionist tendencies? If yes, we have the job for you! We are currently looking for someone to help us with quality assurance on our third major title.

Part of full-time, October through April, with possible extension through Spring/Summer 2020.

Doximity is a San Francisco based company with 50% (~200) remote employees all over North America (including myself in Victoria).
- product is incredible, it's a tool to help doctors practice
- the future of the company is very promising
- the pay is fantastic
- the benefits are amazing (including offsites every 3 months travelling all over the US with your team) 
I love working there and I am posting this because I'd love to help the company (I work as a Data Engineer, so iOS Developer isn't very close to me).
Rooof is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer! We offer lots of great perks like fully paid benefits, RSP matching, fitness subsidies, parental leave, and much more!
Kano is releasing their next game -- Fubar!! And we're looking for a Dev. to join us!
We're looking for great developers of various experience levels to join our team! If you love Java WE WANT TO MEET YOU!
FTS has made environmental weather stations for over 30 years, however building our SaaS products is like a start-up inside of a larger company.

We're interviewing for the next couple of weeks and hoping to wrap up offers by the end of September so that new hires can join us for a retreat in Cancún the week of October 20. If you have any questions don't hesitate to ask me (Sami Samhuri) here or anywhere else you find me online!
